intro: Ranunculus clavicornis, commonly known as the horned buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and bright yellow flowers with five to nine sepals that resemble petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Ranunculus clavicornis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
